reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went from April 10 to the 17, 2013, for a nice couples getaway. We booked through Sears with Sunwing Vacations. We did our seat selection as usual, all went well. great service as usual.
reviews.title: great trip again this time....but Dont pay for Diamond club ;(

reviews.text: We have been on many other trips to all inclusive (including Cuba), but this resort is very nice but not a five star.... maybe a 4 max , the beach is truly breathtaking though !
reviews.title: Perfect for relaxing family stay
Not a "5" star, not even for Cuba
reviews.text: They Have really dropped in the past year, and I mean in all aspects of the resorts quality and service... But make no mistake, the staff is incredible.... they make your vacation !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved it for a relaxing but fun trip, if you don’t like family resort and kids around and just want to read and lye down in silence, Don't Go – Love to great service, beautiful scenery, beaches to no end, great entertainment staff, music and many activities at the pool and just plain FUN, this resort is not for you!
reviews.title: Great Week at Memories Azul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is magnificent, even for Cuba standard where all beaches are quite amazing, it is breathtaking, not quite like the Royalton next door or ensenachos!!! But hey, lets not be fussy with greatness ….Soft white sand that seam to no end, ocean is crystal like reflections … amazing…
reviews.title: Do NOT Believe the bad reviews.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went from april 13 to april 20, 2013.
reviews.title: Exellent Resort, Service, and Beach !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is the 11th time I come to Cuba. I was extremely satisfied with my visit. The customer service was truly exceptional and the people in general are very kind. My room had an ocean view and was next door to the swimming pool as well. The food was delicious, I had langoustes/lobster tail on two of the nights. The Diamond Club is completely worth it ! The personel are very helpful. The hotel is very well maintained and very clean. As previously mentioned, it is my 11th time coming to Cuba, and this is byfar the best experience I have had so far. The beach is the most beautiful beach I have seen yet; the water is crystal clear and the sand is white like flour. Overall, dismiss the comments below, because I am usually a hard client to please, but I was very satisfied with my trip !
reviews.title: AWESOME TRIP!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned on April 19th from a one week stay at the Memories Azul Beach resort. We had a fantastic vacation. We only booked on April 9th to leave on the 11th. We got an awesome deal for an awesome trip. We had been to Cuba Cayo Coco twice before so we knew what to expect with the food. We brough our own ketchup, salt and pepper,coffee chips, candy and chocolate. You don`t see much of these things there so be sure to pack them. If you don`t like really strong coffee bring your own and use the machine to heat up your water and make instant. We had an ocean front view and were steps from the beach. The beach and ocean are amazing! There is nothing or anywhere like it. YOU can`t Beat the beaches in Cuba! We didn`t diamond club and found out that the only difference was they got one more a la carte then us and a section of the beach was marked off for them with a waiter that you really didn`t get to use because he was soooo busy! We used the beach ever morning and always had lots of chairs sometimes you had to walk far down the beach but we didn`t mind. There was a couple of days when we didn`t have a cabano but we just put on more sunscreen. We had perfect weather every day with not a drop of rain the whole 7 days.
reviews.title: Managed Expectations Necessary

reviews.text: Now for the food! We used the buffet for breakfast - no bacon at all but there was ham and sausage. They have an omelette station so every morning for breakfast we had an omelette with ham and cheese, they also had green pepper and onions. They had hash browns, beans toast and different fruits. For lunch we grabbed a burger at the grill. They had mayo one day never saw ketchup or mustard all week, so bring your own. They did have cheese, cucumber and onion. They were really tasty, we always asked to have them well done. For supper we had 3 a la cartes. The Cuban Grill, which started with coleslaw with shrimp in it, really tasty, then we had soup, pretty good and then it was a choice between Tuna Steak or chicken. I had the Chicken and my husband had the Tuna Steak, both were yummy!
reviews.title: 1st trip to Cuba

reviews.text: SEAFOOD- started with basket of bread, some kind of cream of seafood soup just ok, and then the lobster or chicken main meal, we both had the lobster meal Really good. I wasn`t over cooked and nice and tender. Here we felt rushed and the service wasn`t the best. but the food was good so didn`t mind.
reviews.title: Worst Buffet Experience Ever

reviews.text: Great hotel with excellent staff and room service. Food is great. Sandy beach. Beautiful atmosphere, garden and pools
reviews.title: We had a great family vacation in Azul - amazing hotel located at the sandy beach

reviews.text: Stayed with kids, enjoyed every moment.
reviews.title: Already planning next April's trip with my girls

reviews.text: Staff were so kind, rooms were clean, 5 star food, varieties of food and desserts.
reviews.title: No Complaints!

reviews.text: Great entertainment team(Thomas - physical activity) and tennis coach Alex.
reviews.title: Fun Relaxing Vacation April 2013

reviews.text: Only thing, couldn't booked for the Italian restaurant.
reviews.title: AWESOME BEACH, service B at BEST , Food 6 out of 10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all let me say this resort is huge. We were there for two weeks..April 1 to the 15. We have been to Cuba once before and knew not to expect much as far as food. Of course we didn't starve and always found something to eat. The Buffet food was always cold and they don't have much inway of fruit, the two weeks I never saw a banana. The bus ride from the airport is about 2 hours which is a long drive but if you travel in the daytime you get to see some of the communities of Cuba. The staff at the pool bar (Kailin, Armondo and I am sorry I can not remember the other name) were the greatest. Luise's hamburgers were the best and he was amazing. Pool activity staff were also great. The fries at the 24 hour grill always seemed to be cold and soggy as if they were leftover from the day before. We did some of the a la carte's..Mediterrain was good as well as the Italian, Cuban Grill and El Camino, the Asian was the worst of all we could not eat anything there at all, not good at all. We also did not like that you had cats in the 24 hour Grill while you were eating. Not sure if this resort is short staffed but once we witnessed a bottle of wine spilled in the grill and the staff walked through it instead of cleaning it up...this was like this for hours. also we watched staff memebers walk over litter on the walkways then we went and picked it up. (I know that the guest should not be littering they should have enough respect to bend over and pick up whatever they drop). In the property review it said there was an adult pool which is not an adult pool and that would be a nice thing to have. Three pool in all and one was a family pool which should be enforced. Pools were great.
reviews.title: Huge Resort..Beautiful Beach!

reviews.text: Rooms were clean and comfortable and the weather and beach were awesome as well. I would only return to this resort if I wanted to take a quick getaway and got a good deal however just becasue it is such a big resort and I think being such a big resort sometimes the little things get overlooked. We did however have a Great Vacation
reviews.title: Amazing Beach - Saving Grace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Memories Azul from April 7-14th. I have used TripAdvisor as a research tool for many hotels in the past, and generally have found negative reviews to be from “complainers” and always took it with a grain of salt. Unfortunately, this is not the case with Memories Azul. The bad reviews on here are accurate, and I will share mine. Apologies for the length of the review, I tried to be as detailed as possible.
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front Desk: pretty useless, not very helpful. People push in front of you while you’re trying to get an answer on your query. Not a great “first impression”. Also, didn't instil any trust to go to them going forward with any issues…best bet is to talk to the people who take care of things directly, e.g. the maid, or the guys driving the golf carts if you want someone to take your bags to/from the room..which by the way, we did not have help with. Perhaps if you have mobility issues they would be more apt to help. Another little thing that happened was we were given rooms on Pariso side, but I didn't realize this until we were dropped off at the Pariso hotel. I kept telling them we were at Azul but they didn't believe me. I had to take my itinerary to the front desk to have them move us to the correct hotel. I didn't realize it at the time, but the hotels are literally right next to each other, so we could have just walked to the Azul side and got it sorted out.
reviews.title: Memories - Apr 03-10, 2013

reviews.text: The Beach: by far the most amazing beach I have seen. The water is clear like a swimming pool, the sand white and powdery. Little shells can be collected, and it’s perfectly safe for babies and children. The first few days we were there it was very, very windy, so the water was a bit rougher, they had the red flag out. But after that, the wind died down and it was bliss. Tips: make sure you “book” your palapa if you need one by 6 or 7am. Not joking. My husband would go out every morning at around 7 or 7.30 and there would usually only be one or two palapa’s left. And there are lots! Tons of beach chairs though, so if you don’t care about shade you will definitely find a spot to chill on the beach. Oh, when I say “book” I mean to put your towels on a chair to claim it as yours. We had no trouble the entire time we were there, nobody was ever in our spot when we returned to use it, I often left my beach bag with my camera and Iphone and always felt safe. The beach was by far the most relaxing place at the resort. There is a DJ there who at around 10am starts to play music. Yes there were 2 days where I heard Gangham Style, but it wasn't the usual DJ who is there 5 days a week…so they were forgiven for that. LOL. They have activities at the beach if you want to partake, but honestly, it wasn't as annoying as I thought it would be (and I hate that kind of thing). Mostly because the sound of the surf drowns out the brashness of the microphone and music, so it was quite pleasant. And the further from the bar/DJ stand you were, the less you could hear it. The best time to go is after 2 or 3pm, the water is super warm, lots of people have left by then and it’s a lot quieter. The beach is this hotel’s only saving grace.
reviews.title: Had an awesome time
